intro: Ulmarronia, commonly known as the sacred tree of the Yoruba people, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is often found in forested areas and is known for its medicinal properties. Its bark and leaves are used in traditional medicine to treat various ailments. Ulmarronia plays a significant role in both cultural and ecological contexts in its native region.
